title: 109_s136
content:
The table of contents includes sections on authorized payments for educational services in Yosemite National Park, park facilities outside the park boundaries, boundary adjustment for Rancho Corral de Tierra in Golden Gate National Recreation Area, and Redwood National Park boundary adjustment. The Secretary of the Interior may provide funds to California school districts for educational services to students who are dependents of Yosemite National Park personnel or live near the park on U.S. property. Funding will cease if California or local agencies do not maintain per-student funding levels. Payments are restricted to paying public employees for educational services. Payments under this section are limited to $400,000 per fiscal year or the amount needed for educational services for students in California. The funds come from the National Park Service, excluding certain sources. Payments under this section include entrance or use fees at National Park System units, unexpended receipts from specific programs, and emergency appropriations for flood recovery at Yosemite National Park. Emergency appropriations for flood recovery at Yosemite National Park may only be made if the park's available funding exceeds the prior fiscal year's amount. Congress emphasizes that these payments should not reduce funds from any specific source and that funding levels should reflect annual increases in the park's operating base funds. SEC. 102. AUTHORIZATION FOR PARK FACILITIES OUTSIDE YOSEMITE NATIONAL PARK. Amendment to funding authority and fee authority for transportation systems and facilities in national parks, including Yosemite National Park. Changes include clarifying language and expanding the types of contracts allowed for transportation services. TITLE II--Rancho Corral de Tierra Golden Gate National Recreation Area Boundary Adjustment Act, also known as SEC. 201, establishes the short title for the act. SEC. 202 pertains to the Golden Gate National Recreation Area in California. Section 2(a) of Public Law 92-589 is amended to include additional lands in the recreation area, such as parcels numbered by the Assessor of Marin County, California, and lands and waters in San Mateo County. The Golden Gate National Recreation Area is expanded to include lands in San Mateo County, acquired under specific acts, and depicted on various maps. The Secretary is limited to acquiring land from willing sellers. TITLE III--REDWOOD NATIONAL PARK BOUNDARY ADJUSTMENT

This title is known as the Redwood National Park Boundary Adjustment Act of 2005. It involves adjusting the boundary of Redwood National Park. Section 2(a) of the Act of Public Law 90-545 (16 U.S.C. 79b(a)) is amended to define the boundaries of Redwood National Park and provide access to the map for public inspection and distribution to relevant county officers in California. The boundaries of Redwood National Park are redefined to include 133,000 acres. The curr_chunk is about the roles of the Speaker of the House of Representatives and the Vice President of the United States as President of the Senate.
